messageBody:
haefeleuser wrote:

> > Look for junit.extensions.TestSetup. I think it's your solution.
> >
> > One thing: I have never needed to override runBare(). Can you
> > explain
> > why you need to do it?
> >
> > Thanks.
> > --
> > J. B. Rainsberger,
> > Diaspar Software Services
> > http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> > Let's write software that people understand
>
> I override runBare() because if a test fails and if an exception
> occurs in the tearDown() method, then the test failure meassage is
> swallowed by JUnit and the exception message is shown of the tearDown
> () method instead. So I override runBare(). Now the JUnit result
> shows the test failure message. The exception in tearDown() is
> printed to the console. That was a question I asked half a year ago
> here and someone told me to override runBare() for this requirement.

Makes sense, although I make it a goal to refactor in the direction of
not needing tearDown() at all, let alone having it possibly fail.

> But back to my original question and to your answer. I didn't test
> your solution yet, but it seems to work from the first sight.
>
> I think this is what you mean:
>
> public static void main(String[] args) {
> TestSuite testSuite = new TestSuite();
> testSuite.add(new MyTest("someTest"));
> // MyTestSetup subclasses TestSetup
> TestDecorator testSetup = new MyTestSetup(testSuite);
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(testSetup);
> }
>
> But we run our JUnit tests in Eclipse. Eclipse has an own nice
> graphical JUnit view (written by Erich Gamma) to display the
> results. Now the problem with your solution seems to be this: How
> can I teach Eclipse to run the TestDecorator?

Create a custom suite() method with the code above, but returning testSetup.

class MyTest {
public static Test suite() {
// your code here
}
}

> It would be no problem if I would start a main method. But that
> doesn't work for the Eclipse JUnit view, or am I wrong? Is there
> a way to use your solution for the Eclipse JUnit view?

I think so.

> Thanks in advance!

Don't thank me until it works. :)
